title: Penner-Ash 2015 Pas de Nom Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This reserve-level wine was assembled from barrels representing six different vineyards. It's aromatic, with berry and cherry scents that carry into the midpalate. It was aged for 10 months in 40% new oak. Cellaring for another year would certainly be advised.

title: R. Stuart & Co. 2015 Autograph Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's cherry fruit is framed by aggressive phenolic notes. They bring a definite bite to the flavors, and the tannins remain stiff and rather hard. Additional bottle age and/or aggressive aeration are recommended, as the wine improved significantly after being open for a full day.

title: Rijckaert 2016 Les Crays vers Vaux Vieilles Vignes  (Mâcon-Lugny)
description: This deliciously rich and ripe wine is full of generous fruits with great depth of flavor. The concentration and the warm white fruits are intense with acidity and crispness. This is a wine to age a little longer. Drink from 2019.
designation: Les Crays vers Vaux Vieilles Vignes

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Reserva Producción Limitada Tempranillo Blanco (Rioja)
description: This barrel-fermented Tempranillo Blanco is low in intensity on the nose. However, in the mouth it is linear and shows strong acidity. Oxidized, old-school flavors of dry white fruits and oak finish long and mellow. Drink this classic white Rioja through 2020.

title: Sanguis 2015 Sprezzatura No. 5 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A dark shade of rusty pink, this bottling shows red cherry, wet stone, muddy loam and baking spice on the unique and dynamic nose. Cherries shine on the sip as do clove, fennel and baked good flavors. Rather complex for a pink wine.

title: Seagrape 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright lemon and orange rind aromas meet with sea salt, nectarine and a yellow grapefruit pith on the nose of this bottling by Karen Steinwachs. Tightly wound on the palate, this single-vineyard expression shows fresh and lively flavors of citrus pith, yogurt and Brie rind. Could use a bit more time in bottle to fully shine.

title: Somlói Vándor 2015 Olasrizling (Nagy-Somló)
description: Aromas of apple and freshly cut Bartlett pear carry the nose, while flavors of white peach and pear juice mark the crisp palate. Bracing minerality and a slightly astringent finish help maintain balance.

title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 OSU Woodhall III Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This was sourced from vines planted in 1978—a rarity at this price. It's floral on the nose, with light baby powder scents. Pretty plum fruit, sweet spice and a streak of cola add texture and complexity. It's drinking nicely, so don't wait.

title: Tedeschi 2015 Capitel San Rocco  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)
description: Aromas of raisin, porcini mushroom and tobacco leaf are front and center. On the juicy palate, velvety tannins carry ripe black cherry, nutmeg and a hint of candied orange alongside fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosato (Etna)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean herb, orchard fruit and crushed stone come together on this vibrant rosato made entirely with Nerello Mascalese. The racy palate delivers red cherry, apple, citrus and mineral notes plus tangy acidity.

title: Torbreck 2013 RunRig Shiraz-Viognier (Barossa)
description: Opaque in color, this wine is dense in blackberry, dark chocolate, cola and vanillin oak aromas. A hot, full-bodied palate is full of plush dark fruit and more oak. This is a powerful, ultra rich red that's seen a lot of sunshine. Drink 2019–2037.

title: Troon 2016 Cuvée Rolle Vermentino (Applegate Valley)
description: Co-fermentation with 10% Marsanne has added flesh and white peach flavors to the green fruit of this Vermentino. Despite its youth, it's smooth and well-integrated, with a touch of vanilla cream on the finish.

title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Terre d'Enfance  (Santenay)
description: This is a single-vineyard wine, although not a Premier Cru. It is ripe with plenty of strawberry fruit. Still young though, it is also filled with tannins and tight, juicy acidity that need to soften into the fruits. The wine is potentially warm and ripe. Drink from 2021.

title: Wine by Joe 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: All the white wines from this budget-friendly label managed by Joe Dobbes are simply excellent values. In this new vintage, the Pinot Blanc stands out for its tart, racy mix of citrus, apple and white peach fruit. It's exactly the sort of white to drink on a weeknight with a simple pasta or chicken dish.

title: Zonin 2015  Valpolicella Superiore Ripasso
description: Plum, red-skinned berry and a hint of white-almond aromas take center stage. The refined palate shows black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Cristom 2015 Marjorie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: From the oldest section of the estate vineyard, this offers rounded strawberry and Bing cherry flavors. It's appealing, though not quite as interesting as some of the other 2015s, and should be enjoyed within five years of the vintage.

title: David Hill 2015 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This toasty, tasty wine balances its apple, peach and banana fruit with barrel flavors and sweet toast scents. It was barrel aged for 15 months in 20% new oak.

title: Domaine Carrette 2016 Closerie des Alisiers  (Saint-Véran)
description: Immediately attractive, this is a ripe wine with good fruitiness. It has a mineral edge along with a creamy white-fruit texture. Layers of acidity, spice and zesty orange complete a delicious wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Côtes de Nuits Villages)
description: From vines that lie behind the main Côte de Nuits, this rich wine shows how even the cooler vineyards have made sumptuous wines in 2015. The wine is soft, gently tannic with plenty of red fruits. It is likely to develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Domaine des Valanges 2016  Saint-Véran
description: This bold, rich wine is full of fruit while also having a tight texture that will allow it to age. It comes from a blend of different parcels that together give a precise and nuanced picture of Saint-Véran. With its edge of minerality, this wine should age, so drink from late 2018.

title: Dr. Nägler 2016 Rüdesheimer Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)
description: A trace of savory earth tones lend contrast to lively green plum, lime and gooseberry notes in this slightly off-dry Riesling. Light-footed and frisky, it's a refreshing, spry wine to enjoy now through 2019.

title: El Esteco 2014 Chañar Punco Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Calchaquí Valley)
description: This wine's reduced, rubbery aromas take a long time to come around. It's tight as nails and hard as a rock. Its narrow flavor profile includes toast and herbal plum and cassis notes that never fully unwind. Drink this Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon blend through 2025.

title: Fabrice Larochette 2016 Le Château de Chaintré  (Mâcon Chaintré)
description: From the home vineyard of the Larochette family, this wine has some structure as well as great fruit. It is dense, full of rich white stone fruits, touches of vanilla and a terrific juiciness that conveys succulence. Drink the wine from late 2018.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Predator Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Dried blueberries and plums, leather, tobacco, tar and baked goods show on the nose of this bottling, which is enhanced by 15% Petite Sirah and 10% Monastrell. The palate also shows a somewhat dried character of blueberry and Concord grape, with a touch of tar, framed by decent structure and fine acidity.

title: Leeuwin Estate 2013 Art Series Shiraz (Margaret River)
description: The nose of this wine brings forth characters of soap, slightly sweet oak, red and black cherries and potpourri. The medium-bodied palate is more promising: The fruit is brambly and there's an earthy core that comes into play. Tightly wound tannins meld with plentiful acidity, indicating that there's more life left in this wine yet. Drink now–2027.

title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin
description: This smoky, toasty wine is ripe with swathes of bright red fruits. It is also structured, offering rich tannins and juicy acidity in an appealing combination. Melding richness and fruit, the wine will be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Marques de Griñon 2013 AAA Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
description: Maximum ripeness is conveyed through concentrated berry aromas. On the palate, that same ripeness includes blazing tartaric acidity that creates a scratchy mouthfeel. Blasting raisin, cassis and berry flavors see screechy acidity take over on the finish, with oaky flavor remnants. This is equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot

title: Milestii Mici 1987 Codru Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Moldova)
description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Merlot has aromas of black plum, graphite and black raspberry. Flavors of brown baking spices, black plum, and black raspberry meld with velvet mouthfeel. The tannins are smooth and the finish is persistent.

title: Pike Road 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine's inviting cherry pie aromas come with chicory, burnt sugar and smoke overtones. The tannins are drying, but the flavor and power are greater than the price tag would suggest.

title: Punta Greca 2013 Merlot (Istria)
description: Hailing from Istria, this Croatian Merlot has aromas of blackberry, raspberry and red plum. In the mouth there are flavors of red plum and black cherry with a persistent finish.
